subclass.name: College of Grandmother's Tales
subclassFeatures: Bardic College of Grandmother's Tales|Bard|PHB|Grandmother's Tales|Ar8|3

subclassFeature.name: Bardic College of Grandmother's Tales
entries: Es gibt nur wenige Übel, die so furchterregend sind wie die böse Hexe. Sie lebt im Wald, im Sumpf oder auf der Spitze eines Turms und sperrt ein, raubt, verstümmelt oder ermordet alle, die in ihre Nähe kommen. Barden wissen um die Macht einer guten Geschichte, und die Anhänger des Kollegiums von Großmutters Geschichten nutzen den Schrecken der bösen Hexe zu ihrem Vorteil. Sie nutzen die Ängste vor dem Altwerden, der Sterblichkeit, dem Verlust der Handlungsfähigkeit und der Unfähigkeit, den Menschen zu vertrauen, die einem am nächsten stehen, um ihre Feinde zu erschrecken.

subclassFeature.name: Book of Tales
entries: Wenn du auf Stufe 3 dem Kolleg für Großmutters Geschichten beitrittst, erhältst du ein Buch mit Märchen, Noten oder Gedichten, das du als Zauberfokus für deine Bardenzauber verwenden kannst. Wenn du diesen Fokus verlierst, musst du ein neues Buch schreiben oder kaufen.

subclassFeature.name: Have a Bite
entries: Ebenfalls auf Stufe 3 fügst du deinen Geschichten Geschichten über vergiftete Früchte hinzu, die den Märchenkönigen gegeben wurden. Du erlernst den {@spell poison spray} Zaubertrick, der nicht auf die Anzahl der Bardenzauber angerechnet wird, die du kennst.

Additionally, as an action, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard|PHB|1|PHB}, choose one creature within 30 feet of you that can hear you, and roll the {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard|PHB|1|PHB} die. The target must make a Constitution saving throw against {@dcYourSpellSave}. On a failure, the target takes poison damage equal to the roll plus your Charisma modifier and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful save, a target takes only half the damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}.

At 5th level, a creature that fails its saving throw against this feature becomes {@condition poisoned} and falls {@condition prone}. At 10th level, a creature that fails its saving throw against this feature becomes {@condition poisoned} and falls {@condition prone}, and while {@condition poisoned} in this way, the creature's speed is reduced to 0. At 15th level, a creature that fails its saving throw against this feature becomes {@condition poisoned} and falls {@condition prone}, and while {@condition poisoned} in this way, the creature's speed is reduced to 0 and it is {@condition incapacitated}.

subclassFeature.name: Horrifying Performance
entries: Also at 3rd level, you learn to tell quick, terrifying stories that make any creature seem nightmarish. As an action, you perform a short tale or song about a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see. Every creature of your choice that can hear you and is within 15 feet of the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against {@dcYourSpellSave} or be {@condition frightened} of the target for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The creature has disadvantage on the saving throw to end the effect if it has taken damage from the target since the end of its last turn.
Wenn Sie diese Funktion verwenden, können Sie sie erst wieder nach einer kurzen oder langen Pause nutzen.

subclassFeature.name: Granny's Here
entries: When you reach 6th level, you can use your action to summon a spectral witch from a book of tales, sheet music, or another storytelling device. It uses the {@creature Ethereal Hag|Ar8} stat block and shares your proficiency bonus. The hag is friendly to you and your companions, seeing all of you as her grandchildren. She lives for 1 hour, until she is reduced to 0 hit points, or until you die.

In combat, the {@creature Ethereal Hag|Ar8} shares your initiative count, but takes her turn immediately after yours. She can move and use her reaction on her own, but the only action she takes on her turn is the {@action Dodge} action, unless you use a bonus action on your turn to command her to take another action. That action can be one in her stat block or some other action. If you are {@condition incapacitated}, she can take any action of her choice, not just the {@action Dodge} action.
Once you summon an {@creature Ethereal Hag|Ar8} with this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Poisonous Performance
entries: By 14th level, your terrifying words sting. Your {@subclassFeature Horrifying Performance|Bard|PHB|Grandmother's Tales|Ar8|3|Ar8} affects creatures of your choice that can hear you within 30 feet of the target.

If a creature fails its saving throw against your {@subclassFeature Horrifying Performance|Bard|PHB|Grandmother's Tales|Ar8|3|Ar8}, you can immediately use {@subclassFeature Have a Bite|Bard|PHB|Grandmother's Tales|Ar8|3|Ar8} against it as a reaction. The target has disadvantage on the saving throw against {@subclassFeature Have a Bite|Bard|PHB|Grandmother's Tales|Ar8|3|Ar8}.

subclassFeature.name: Wicked Witch Sorcerous Origin
entries: Die meisten Hexen können eine Vielzahl von Erscheinungsformen annehmen und haben nichts dagegen, sich mit Humanoiden einzulassen, vor allem wenn die Sterblichen ihren Interessen dienen. Die Nachkommen dieser Liaisons zeigen eine frühe Begabung für magische Unruhe. Manche Hexen ziehen diese Kinder als ihre eigenen Diener auf und erlauben ihnen vielleicht sogar, dem Hexenzirkel beizutreten. Andere bleiben bei ihren sterblichen Eltern, die in der Regel schockiert sind, wenn ihr Kleinkind anfängt, in ihre Träume einzudringen oder ihre beste Kleidung mit bösartigen Krallen zu zerreißen.

subclassFeature.name: Granny's Gifts
entries: Starting at 1st level, you learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the {@table Granny's Spells|Ar8} table. Each of these spells counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

Whenever you gain a sorcerer level, you can replace one spell you gained from this feature with another spell of the same level. The new spell must be {@filter an enchantment or an illusion spell from the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list|spells|level=1;2;3;4;5|class=sorcerer;wizard;warlock|school=e;i}.

Darüber hinaus bietet dir dein Vorfahre bestimmte Widerstandsfähigkeiten, die du an andere weitergeben kannst. Wenn du eine lange Ruhepause beendest, wähle dich selbst oder eine Kreatur im Umkreis von 30 Fuß, die du sehen kannst. Das Ziel hat bis zum Ende deiner nächsten langen Ruhepause oder bis zu deinem Tod Vorteil bei Rettungswürfen gegen {@condition charmed} oder {@condition frightened} zu sein.

subclassFeature.name: Hag Ancestor
entries: Also at 1st level, choose your ancestor's kind or determine it randomly on the {@table Ancestor Kind|Ar8} table below. The magic specialty associated with each hag is used by features you gain later.

Du kannst die Sprache deines Vorfahren sprechen, lesen und schreiben, und du erhältst den durch die Art festgelegten Kompetenzbonus. Außerdem hast du einen Vorteil bei Charisma-Proben, um Geister zu beeinflussen.

subclassFeature.name: Clever Little Witch
entries: At 6th level, you can turn your enemies' spells against them. When a creature targets you or an ally within 15 feet of you with a spell of 1st level or higher that targets only one creature and requires an attack roll or forces the target to make a saving throw, you can use your reaction immediately after the spell resolves and spend a number of sorcery points equal to the spell's level to cast it back at the caster, without expending material components. This spell uses {@dcYourSpellSave} and spell attack bonus, and if it is from your ancestor's specialty school, it costs half the number of sorcery points (rounded down).

subclassFeature.name: Fly, My Pretty
entries: At 14th level, when you finish a long rest, you can touch a Small or Medium object of your choice, such as a broom, {@item bedroll|PHB}, or {@item bagpipes|PHB}, and enchant it to fly.

Der verzauberte Gegenstand funktioniert normal, bis du oder eine andere Kreatur rittlings auf ihm steht und eine Aktion oder Bonusaktion einsetzt, um sein Befehlswort zu sprechen (das du bei der Verzauberung des Gegenstands gewählt hast). Dann schwebt er und kann in der Luft geritten werden. Wenn du eine weitere Aktion oder Bonusaktion verwendest, um das Befehlswort erneut zu sprechen, hört der Gegenstand auf zu schweben.

Im Schwebezustand hat der Gegenstand eine Fluggeschwindigkeit von 60 Fuß. Er kann eine kleine oder mittlere Kreatur tragen, zusammen mit allem, was die Kreatur trägt oder bei sich hat. Während eine Kreatur auf dem Gegenstand fliegt, kann sie nicht {@condition charmed} oder {@condition frightened} sein.
Wenn du einen neuen fliegenden Gegenstand verzauberst, wird der vorherige Gegenstand unbrauchbar.

subclassFeature.name: Coven Calling
entries: By 18th level, you seek vengeance on the spellweavers who would not accept you or your ancestors. When you use {@subclassFeature Clever Little Witch|Sorcerer|PHB|Wicked Witch|Ar8|6|Ar8}, you can cast any spell of 1st level or higher you saw the triggering creature cast in the last minute by spending sorcery points equal to the spell's level or, if it is from your ancestor's specialty school, half the number of sorcery points (rounded down).

Zusätzlich kannst du 2 Zauberpunkte als Aktion ausgeben, um zwei heidenartige Duplikate von dir in deinem Raum zu beschwören. Sie funktionieren wie die Duplikate des {@spell mirror image}-Zaubers, können aber sofort nach dir auf die gleiche Anzahl von Initiativen agieren. Ein Duplikat kann in seinem Zug nur eine Aktion ausführen, um einen dir bekannten Zauber der Stufe 1, 2 oder 3 mit sofortiger Dauer zu wirken. Du musst Zauberpunkte in Höhe der Stufe des Zaubers ausgeben, damit das Duplikat ihn wirken kann.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Cantrip
entries: Auf der 1. Stufe erlernst du den {@spell vicious mockery} Zaubertrick. Er zählt für dich als Zaubertrick eines Hexenmeisters, wird aber nicht auf die Anzahl deiner bekannten Zauber angerechnet.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: Der Hag lässt dich aus einer erweiterten Liste von Zaubern wählen, wenn du einen Hexenmeisterzauber lernst. Die folgenden Zauber werden der Zauberliste des Hexenmeisters hinzugefügt, abhängig von der Art deines Gönners: Grün, Nacht, Meer oder Hexenzirkel.

subclassFeature.name: Hag Kind
entries: Wähle die Art deines Schutzherren oder bestimme sie zufällig, indem du auf der unten stehenden Tabelle für die Art der Geister würfelst. Wenn dein Schutzherr ein Hexenzirkel ist, erhältst du die Zirkel-Eigenschaften dieser Unterklasse, unabhängig von der Art der Hexen, aus denen der Zirkel besteht.

subclassFeature.name: Horrifying Appearance
entries: At 1st level, you can use a bonus action to make your appearance monstrous with massive, knobbly clawed hands for 1 minute. When you change your appearance, each creature you choose within 30 feet of you that can see you must make a Wisdom saving throw against {@dcYourSpellSave} or become {@condition frightened} of you until you no longer appear monstrous. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, at disadvantage if you are still in line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to your Horrific Appearance for the next 24 hours.

Solange du monströs aussiehst, kannst du eine Aktion nutzen, um eine Kreatur im Umkreis von 5 Fuß mit deinen Klauen anzugreifen, die bei einem Treffer {@damage 2d8} Hiebschaden verursachen. Du kannst deinen Charisma-Modifikator für die Angriffs- und Schadenswürfe der Klauen verwenden.
Wenn Sie diese Funktion verwenden, können Sie sie erst wieder nach einer kurzen oder langen Pause nutzen.

subclassFeature.name: Warlock Hag Patron
entries: Großmutterhexen hören nie auf zu intrigieren und freuen sich über die Unterstützung eines Lakaien... Hexenmeisters... dasselbe. Sie bilden Assistenten aus, die sich mit Kräuterkunde, Tierpflege, Zauberei und Bedrohung beschäftigen. Mit der Zeit verlassen sich diese Hexenmeister auf ihre Großmütter, wenn es um magische Gaben geht.

Hexen sind engagierte Schutzherren. Sie bestrafen ihre Hexenmeister schnell, wenn sie gegen ihre Interessen handeln, sind rechthaberisch und wollen ihre "Enkelkinder" formen. Hexenmeister, die einen ganzen Hexenzirkel als Mentor haben, müssen sich in der Regel auch mit der Politik zwischen den Zirkeln auseinandersetzen, wobei jede Hexe den Hexenmeister benutzt, um sich Vorteile gegenüber den anderen Hexen zu verschaffen.

subclassFeature.name: Coven
entries: You learn to create a {@i lesser hag's eye} by coating an eye in varnish and performing a ritual upon it. Crafting a {@i lesser hag's eye} requires 1 hour of uninterrupted work, which can coincide with a short or long rest. While you are on the same plane of existence as the {@i lesser hag's eye}, you can use an action to see through it until the start of your next turn. While you see through the eye, you can see {@condition invisible} creatures and objects as if they were visible, though you are {@condition blinded||blind} with regard to your own senses. A {@i lesser hag's eye} has AC 10 and 1 hit point. If it is destroyed by someone other than you, you take {@damage 3d8} psychic damage.
Wenn Sie eine neue {@i lesser hag's eye} erstellen, wird die vorherige nicht mehr funktionieren.

subclassFeature.name: Green
entries: As an action, you magically turn {@condition invisible} for 10 minutes or until you attack, cast a spell, or your {@status concentration} ends (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). While {@condition invisible}, you leave no physical evidence of your passage, so you can be tracked only by magic. Any equipment you wear or carry is {@condition invisible} with you. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Night
entries: You learn to craft a {@i lesser heartstone}, a magical lustrous black gem. Crafting a {@i lesser heartstone} requires 4 hours of uninterrupted work, which can coincide with a long rest.

Solange du den Stein in der Hand hältst, kannst du den {@spell etherealness}-Zauber mit einer Aktion wirken, ohne einen Zauberslot zu verbrauchen, aber der Zauber endet nach einer Anzahl von Runden, die deinem Befähigungsbonus entspricht. Nachdem du den {@i lesser heartstone} auf diese Weise benutzt hast, wird er zerstört.
Wenn Sie eine neue {@i lesser heartstone} erstellen, wird die vorherige nicht mehr funktionieren.

subclassFeature.name: Sea
entries: You gain a swimming speed of 40 feet, and you can breathe underwater. When you are fully submerged, any creature that is also fully submerged can understand your speech if you share a language, and you can understand theirs.

Additionally, you can pollute the very ground upon which you walk or waters where you swim. As an action, you release noxious vapors in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on yourself for 10 minutes. Any nonmagical plant in the area that is not a creature withers and dies. Any creature of your choice that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against {@dcYourSpellSave} or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once you pollute your environment in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Auntie's Travel Guide
entries: Ab der 6. Stufe gewährt dir dein Gönner eine seiner Lieblingsfähigkeiten, um deine Flucht zu beschleunigen oder deine Feinde auszuspionieren.

subclassFeature.name: Wicked Claws
entries: Beginning at 10th level, when taking on your {@subclassFeature Horrifying Appearance|Warlock|PHB|Hag|Ar8|1|Ar8}, your claws are empowered with the fear of your enemies. Your claws deal an extra {@damage 2d8} psychic damage on a hit, plus an additional {@damage 3d8} psychic damage if the target is {@condition frightened}.
Your {@subclassFeature Horrifying Appearance|Warlock|PHB|Hag|Ar8|1|Ar8} now lasts a number of minutes equal to your warlock level.
While your {@subclassFeature Horrifying Appearance|Warlock|PHB|Hag|Ar8|1|Ar8} is active, you can't be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

subclassFeature.name: Coven
entries: Your {@i lesser hag's eye} is imbued with the power of your coven. Your hag's eye can hover up to 15 feet in the air as long as it is within 120 feet of you. On your turn, you can move a floating eye up to 30 feet in any direction (no action). If the eye is more than 120 feet from you, it falls.
Außerdem kannst du, wenn du einen Zauber mit einer Wirkzeit von 1 Aktion wirkst, eine Bonusaktion verwenden, um ihn aus dem Auge zu wirken, als ob du dich im Raum des Auges befändest.

You can also use an action to explode your hag's eye in a 60-foot-radius sphere of psychic energy. All creatures in the area must make a Wisdom saving throw against {@dcYourSpellSave}, taking {@damage 4d10} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

subclassFeature.name: Green
entries: You can expertly mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices you have heard. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check against {@dcYourSpellSave}.

Additionally, while mimicking a sound or voice, you can target one creature that can hear and understand you within 60 feet of you, reminding them of all their failures, flaws, and insecurities. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against {@dcYourSpellSave}. On a success, the target takes {@damage 4d10} psychic damage. On a failure, it is {@condition charmed} by you for 1 minute. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target falls {@condition prone} and is {@condition incapacitated} for the duration, thinking only of its faults. A {@condition charmed} target can repeat the saving throw whenever it takes damage, ending the condition on itself on a success and taking no psychic damage as a result of the effect ending. Once you attempt to charm a creature with this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Night
entries: While in possession of a {@i lesser heartstone}, you hold the power of disease and death in your hands. As a bonus action, you can touch your {@i lesser heartstone} to a creature and choose one of the following two options: cure the target of all diseases affecting it or cast {@spell finger of death} without expending a spell slot (targeting the creature you touch with the {@i lesser heartstone}) and gaining temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt by the spell. Once you use the {@i lesser heartstone} in this way, you can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Sea
entries: No one can stand against your horrifying gaze. As an action, you can target one {@condition frightened} creature you can see within 30 feet of you. If the target can see you, it must make a Wisdom saving throw against {@dcYourSpellSave}. On a failed save, its hit points are reduced to 0. On a successful save, it takes {@damage 5d10} psychic damage. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Grandmother's Wrath
entries: Ab Stufe 14 quälst und verwirrst du deine Feinde in einem Stil, der dem Typus deines Gönners entspricht.

spell.name: Breath Weapon
entries: Wähle Säure, Kälte, Feuer, Blitz oder Gift. Du verströmst Energie der gewählten Art in einem Wirkungsbereich deiner Wahl: einem Kegel von 30 Fuß oder einer Linie von 60 Fuß. Jede Kreatur in diesem Bereich muss einen Rettungswurf in Geschicklichkeit machen und erleidet bei einem misslungenen Rettungswurf {@damage 8d6} Schaden des gewählten Typs, bei einem erfolgreichen Rettungswurf halb so viel Schaden.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

item.name: Compass of Escape
entries: Die Nadel dieses kleinen Messingkompasses bewegt sich nicht, wenn man sich im Freien befindet. Befindet sich der Kompass in einem geschlossenen Raum wie einem Gebäude oder einer Höhle, zeigt die Nadel immer zum nächsten Ausgang ins Freie, ohne Berücksichtigung von Hindernissen oder Gefahren auf dem Weg.

item.name: Harvesting Kit
entries: A harvesting kit contains ten {@item vial|PHB|vials}, two tweezers, three harvesting knives (small, medium and large), and pieces of burlap fabric. The kit costs 20 gp. When you harvest components from a creature's remains with a harvesting kit, make a Dexterity check, adding your proficiency bonus if you are proficient with the kit. You also can harvest components from monsters without a harvesting kit using any sharpened blade, but checks to do so are made with disadvantage.

item.name: Merfolk's Tear
entries: Legend says that this silver chain holding two blue teardrop pendants was a gift from a goddess to unite a human with their merfolk lover. While wearing this pendant, you can breathe underwater, you can speak and understand {@language Primordial||Aquan}, and you have a swimming speed of 40 feet.

item.name: Ring of Light
entries: Wenn du diesen silbernen Ring mit einem runden Bernstein trägst, kannst du eine Aktion nutzen, um das Befehlswort zu sprechen, damit der Stein ein helles, goldenes Licht in einem Radius von 30 Fuß ausstrahlt und das Licht für weitere 30 Fuß verdunkelt. Das Bedecken des Steins blockiert das Licht. Das Licht hält 1 Stunde lang an oder bis du eine Aktion ausführst, um das Befehlswort erneut zu sprechen. Der Ring kann bis zur nächsten Morgendämmerung nicht mehr benutzt werden.

spellcasting.name: Minor Illusion
headerEntries: Emerald can cast the {@spell minor illusion} cantrip at will. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}).

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of her turns, Emerald can use a bonus action to take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} action.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: Wenn Smaragd einem Effekt ausgesetzt ist, der es ihr erlaubt, einen Rettungswurf in Geschicklichkeit zu machen, um nur halben Schaden zu erleiden, erleidet Smaragd keinen Schaden, wenn der Rettungswurf gelingt, und nur halben Schaden, wenn er misslingt.

trait.name: Scimitar of Speed Bonus Attack
entries: In jeder ihrer Runden kann Smaragd eine Bonusaktion nutzen, um einen Angriff mit ihrem Krummsäbel der Geschwindigkeit auszuführen.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Emerald wears a {@item ring of invisibility} and {@item +2 studded leather armor||+2 studded leather}. She wields a {@item scimitar of speed} and a {@item dagger of venom}. She carries {@item goggles of night} but doesn't wear them unless needed.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Emerald deals an extra 21 ({@damage 6d6}) damage when she hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Emerald that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and she doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Smaragd macht zwei Nahkampfangriffe.

action.name: Scimitar of Speed
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dagger of Venom
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d4 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Poison Blade (1/Day)
entries: Smaragd lässt dickes, schwarzes Gift die Klinge ihres Giftdolches überziehen. Das Gift bleibt 1 Minute lang bestehen oder bis ein Angriff mit dieser Waffe eine Kreatur trifft. Diese Kreatur muss einen {@dc 15} Rettungswurf auf Konstitution bestehen oder 11 ({@damage 2d10}) Giftschaden erleiden und 1 Minute lang {@condition poisoned} werden.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: Smaragd halbiert den Schaden, den sie durch einen Angriff erleidet, der sie trifft. Sie muss den Angreifer sehen können.

trait.name: Horrific Appearance
entries: Each humanoid chosen by the hag that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hag and can see her must make a Wisdom saving throw against {@dcYourSpellSave}. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag's Horrific Appearance for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: The hag can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check at {@dc 8 + PB} + your Charisma modifier.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8 +  PB} slashing damage + {@damage 1d6} psychic damage.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: Die ätherische Hexe betritt auf magische Weise die ätherische Dimension von der materiellen Dimension aus oder umgekehrt.

hp.special: health levels equal to their level

trait.name: Retainer
entries: Diese Kreatur ist ein Rückhalter, wie in {@book Strongholds and Followers|SaF|8|Retainers} beschrieben.

action.name: Signature Attack
entries: {@spell poison spray}

action.name: Poisoned Words (3/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 3rd-level retainer}

Der Folklorist zielt auf eine Kreatur innerhalb von 30 Fuß und würfelt {@damage 1d6}. Das Ziel muss einen Rettungswurf für die Konstitution bestehen oder Giftschaden in Höhe der Zahl auf dem Würfelwurf erleiden und 1 Minute lang {@condition poisoned} werden. Bei einem erfolgreichen Schutzwurf erleidet das Ziel nur den Giftschaden und wird nicht {@condition poisoned}.

action.name: Fear (1/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 5th-level retainer}
{@spell fear}

action.name: Conjure Woodland Beings (1/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 7th-level retainer}
{@spell conjure woodland beings}

hp.special: health levels equal to their level

trait.name: Retainer
entries: Diese Kreatur ist ein Rückhalter, wie in {@book Strongholds and Followers|SaF|8|Retainers} beschrieben.

action.name: Signature Attack
entries: {@spell shocking grasp}

action.name: Disguise Self (3/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 3rd-level retainer}
{@spell disguise self}

action.name: Fly (1/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 5th-level retainer}
{@spell fly}

action.name: Clever Little Witch (1/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 7th-level retainer}
Nachdem er von einem Zauber getroffen wurde, der auf eine Kreatur abzielt, wirkt der Enkel denselben Zauber auf ein neues Ziel innerhalb von 30 Fuß.

hp.special: health levels equal to their level

trait.name: Retainer
entries: Diese Kreatur ist ein Rückhalter, wie in {@book Strongholds and Followers|SaF|8|Retainers} beschrieben.

action.name: Signature Attack
entries: {@spell vicious mockery}

action.name: Mirror Image (3/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 3rd-level retainer}
{@spell mirror image}

action.name: Polymorph (1/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 5th-level retainer}
{@spell polymorph}

action.name: Auntie's Travel Guide (1/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 7th-level retainer}
Die Hexe spricht den Zauber {@spell greater invisibility}. Während sie unsichtbar ist, ist die Hexe völlig lautlos und hinterlässt keine Spuren.

monsterFluff.name: Emerald

data.name: Letter from the Editor
entries: We make a lot of monsters at MCDM. New monsters have appeared in the pages of {@i ARCADIA}, as well as in {@loader Strongholds & Followers|collection/MCDM Productions; Strongholds and Followers.json} and the recently-released {@loader Kingdoms & Warfare|book/MCDM Productions; Kingdoms & Warfare.json}. We also make miniatures of all kinds of creatures, from {@link Trudy the ruby wyrmling|https://shop.mcdmproductions.com/collections/miniatures/products/ruby-wyrmling-mini} to {@link Relg, the Lord in Corpulect|https://shop.mcdmproductions.com/collections/miniatures/products/relg-mini}. Our upcoming projects are brimming with fantastical creatures, and lately we've been spending even more time thinking about fantasy creatures great and small. First up is {@i The Beastmaster and Companions}, which includes new rules for player character pets and a class, the beastmaster, that adventures with one of these faithful companions. We're also working on our next big hardcover: a book of creatures that won't just supplement the core monster book, but can also replace it.

Why do we want to create these fantastic creatures? The obvious answer is that they're core to a game that is built around fighting monsters. But if we dig just a little deeper, we're forced to ask why we love a game that revolves around imaginary critters.

First of all, monsters inspire us to tell stories. They do things no creature in the real world can, and they have fascinating lore—whether they originate from centuries of folklore and myth or they're brand-new creations. Such beings make memorable allies and enemies. The mere existence of dragons, unicorns, and xorns makes us ask, "What else is out there?"

I think the first mechanical piece of the game that many GMs homebrew is a monster, because they want to add a creature to their story that doesn't exist anywhere else. It may just be a kobold with 100 more hit points than usual or an ogre with a tarrasque's Reflective Carapace trait, but that monster becomes unique. The GM and players will remember the encounter with the creature that was theirs alone for years to come.

Another question fantastic beasts make us ask is, "If these things about a monster are true, what else is true about this creature? What effects does the existence of this creature have on the world?" For instance, a GM might know that metallic dragons eat gemstones and decide that because powerful creatures devour precious stones, the world has very few left. In fact, owning a gemstone makes you a target for hungry dragons who devoured most of what the earth has to offer and are searching for a last morsel.

{@i ARCADIA 8} is an ode to monsters. While this issue isn't packed with new stat blocks, it does revolve around badass creatures. {@link Jessica Marcrum's|https://twitter.com/Miss_Jess03} "Subclasses of the Hag" turns one of the game's favorite creatures into warlock patrons, bard inspirations, and sorcerer progenitors. Dark deals and endless torments define hags. Why should the GM get to have all the fun? With this article, players can take the reins and tell their own hag-centered stories.

"Monstrous Components" from {@link V.J. Harris|https://twitter.com/victhhe} is inspired by the lore and mechanics of monsters. Have you ever asked, "Do material spell components really matter?" Well, now they do. Get out those harvesting kits and start removing that dead aboleth's eyes, because those peepers are going to turn your spells into finishing moves.

{@link Bianca Bickford's|https://twitter.com/BiancaBickford} "The Emerald Exchange" has one of the most fearsome monsters of all: a human with power and wealth who will do anything to keep both, including betray her friends. After all, wouldn't the allure of gathering as many powerful magic items as possible turn some heroes into the very monsters they battle?
{@i Ex animo,}
Well, yeah! Hear me out. :D

Hey everybody, Matt Colville here! A lot of folks compare {@i ARCADIA} to the classic gaming magazines of yore, and this brings us great joy. At the same time, we're always thinking about ways to capture that same spirit (without severely impacting our schedule).
Something I miss from those 1980s gaming magazines were ads! That may seem strange, but I literally miss them. As a consumer!

For one thing, ads in gaming mags were usually cool. Or fun! You know, these are all small companies, creator owned, making nerd stuff for nerds and so even when I didn't particularly care about the product, it was still cool to see all these different games and accessories. It felt like you were part of a bigger community, not just of players and GMs, but of creators.

Back then, ads in magazines were one of the only ways to learn about new products. Especially if the product came from a smaller company. Frankly, I feel the same way now! There are a ton of companies making cool products that even I don't know anything about, because the internet is huge and it's often impossible for a small company to get its product in front of the right audience.
Since these companies were incredibly tiny and creative owned, owned by nerds, the ads often had personality, which I love.

So, me, I never saw those ads as annoying. I miss them! I still see ads! They just suck. You do a bunch of research on suitcases, pull the trigger on a good suitcase you can afford, and now you see nothing but suitcase ads! Great, thanks. Perfect.

It's amazing how much data these companies have about us, and yet how terrible online ads are. I was on a RPG discussion site and I noticed a banner ad for {@link Gaming Paper|https://gamingpaper.com/} which looked like exactly the kind of thing I needed and would use at my table. So I clicked on the ad! I bought some Gaming Paper, and I've been using it ever since.
It is literally the only time I can remember where I clicked on an ad on a website. Because it's the only time I can remember where the ad was something I actually wanted!

Given all this, we decided to try an experiment. We reached out to some creators we know and asked if they wanted to put an ad in {@i ARCADIA}. Our goal with ads is not to generate revenue (although they will do a little of that) but to put cool products in front of you, that we think you might like, but might not have heard of.

These ads are curated. An ad appearing in {@i ARCADIA} is not an endorsement of the company or the product, but we do our research and want to make sure any ad in {@i ARCADIA} has a reasonable chance of being something we, as consumers, would buy. That's the criteria.

It may seem hard to believe in this cynical world, but we really are introducing ads to {@i ARCADIA} primarily because we think it's neat. It's fun to see other gaming products you didn't know about, and we think it has the potential to be a lot more useful to you, the consumer, than the ads you normally see online, which I find to be pretty useless.
Now, if you notice the ads in here, and they annoy you, please tell us! {@i ARCADIA} is always an experiment. If there's a great hue and cry against them, we'll rethink this whole thing.
But we think they're neat! :D
{@style Three new hag-inspired subclasses for warlocks, sorcerers, and bards|dnd-font;large}
by Jessica Marcrum

Die als Unheilstifterinnen verschrienen Feen verfügen über weit mehr Macht, als ihr Aussehen vermuten lässt. Wenn die Feinde und Opfer einer Hexe sie unterschätzen, gedeiht sie. Die ältesten und weisesten Hexen, die Großmütter, beherrschen diese Täuschung so gut, dass sie in ihren Gemeinden Ehrfurcht einflößen und angehende Hexenmeister um ihre Gunst betteln. Einige Hexenmeister stammen von einer Hexenblutlinie ab und kämpfen darum, von Gemeinschaften akzeptiert zu werden, die ihre "Großmütter" fürchten. Barden erzählen Geschichten von bösen Hexen in den Wäldern, die Kinder und Erwachsene gleichermaßen erschrecken.

entries.name: Legend of the Wicked Witch
entries: Die weise Frau in den Wäldern mit dem Schalk im Nacken. Die uralte alte Frau, die durch die Straßen streift und mit den Gassenhunden spricht. Die freundliche Witwe mit dem beängstigenden Lächeln. Geister verkörpern die Ängste der Menschen vor Manipulation, vor dem Verlorengehen und vor dem Altwerden. Sie sind einsam und verschlagen und haben normalerweise nur tierische Vertraute als Gefährten. Gelegentlich schließen sich die Geister jedoch in Gruppen von drei oder mehr zusammen, um einen Hexenzirkel zu gründen, was ihre Macht und ihre Fähigkeit zur Zauberei erheblich steigert. In einem Hexenzirkel herrscht ebenso viel Zwietracht wie Zuneigung, und die Hexen wetteifern ständig um die Kontrolle übereinander.

All hags share a few key commonalities, regardless of their variety. Most come from the Feywild and possess the faerie fixation with deals. Hags always twist the odds of these pacts in their favor. Rare is the hag without a grand plan, and rarer still is one that resists the natural temptation to prey upon human nature, bending mortals' worst impulses for the hag's amusement. {@creature Green Hag||Green hags} particularly love to toy with mortal emotions. {@creature Night hag||Night hags} are partial to terrifying mortals to death, and {@creature sea hag||sea hags} relish destruction in all forms.

Die in diesem Artikel vorgestellten Unterklassen wurden rund um die Legende der Hexe entwickelt, obwohl jeder beliebige Märchentrickser an ihrer Stelle verwendet werden könnte. Vielleicht lässt sich ein Barde vom Großen Bösen Wolf inspirieren, vielleicht sucht ein Hexenmeister Reynard den Fuchs auf, oder vielleicht stammt ein Zauberer von der gefürchteten Königin Mab ab. Die Legende der Hexe ist groß, aber die Welt der Feen ist riesig und voller Geschichten, die es zu erforschen gilt.

entries.name: Warlock Hag Patron
entries: Großmutterhexen hören nie auf zu intrigieren und freuen sich über die Unterstützung eines Lakaien... Hexenmeisters... dasselbe. Sie bilden Assistenten aus, die sich mit Kräuterkunde, Tierpflege, Zauberei und Bedrohung beschäftigen. Mit der Zeit verlassen sich diese Hexenmeister auf ihre Großmütter, wenn es um magische Gaben geht.

Hexen sind engagierte Schutzherren. Sie bestrafen ihre Hexenmeister schnell, wenn sie gegen ihre Interessen handeln, sind rechthaberisch und wollen ihre "Enkelkinder" formen. Hexenmeister, die einen ganzen Hexenzirkel als Mentor haben, müssen sich in der Regel auch mit der Politik zwischen den Zirkeln auseinandersetzen, wobei jede Hexe den Hexenmeister benutzt, um sich Vorteile gegenüber den anderen Hexen zu verschaffen.

entries.name: Grandmother Hags
entries: Older, wiser, and far more dangerous than the average hag, grandmother hags are powerful beings who warp the world to suit their will. Living alone or ruling over covens, the domain of a grandmother hag is completely under her control. Her magic permeates the area surrounding her lair and bends it to her desires. For instance, grandmother sea hags fill watery caves with slime and rot, while grandmother green hags prefer dense marshes, forests, and swamps filled with animals to serve as her minions. Grandmother night hags live anywhere they find dreamers, twisting the very shadows to horrify their prey.
With little exception, grandmothers are the only hags powerful enough on their own to serve as a patron, sometimes grooming warlocks to become hags and serve in their coven when the time suits.

entries.altText: A witch with a half-moon staff holds an eye up to her own and regards you through the mis-matched pupil
A gnomish witch casts a glittering purple spell, her purple hair whipped up by the magic. A black cat reaches toward the sparkling center of the spell.
A tiefling bard raises her hand while reading from an ancient tome. The spirit of an ancient hag rises from the pages, curving around behind her and raising her arm in a similar gesture.

entries.name: Retainers of the Hag
entries: Retainers first appeared in {@loader Strongholds & Followers|collection/MCDM Productions; Strongholds and Followers.json} as unique NPC followers who pledge their service to player characters. These less-experienced adventurers are easy-to-run secondary characters controlled by players. Below are retainer stat blocks for NPCs that wield the magic of hags.
The {@book full rules for retainers|SaF|8|Retainers} are explained in {@loader Strongholds & Followers|collection/MCDM Productions; Strongholds and Followers.json}.

entries.name: Witch
entries: The witch retainer is inspired by the {@subclass Hag|Warlock|PHB|Ar8|Hag warlock patron}.

entries.name: Grandchild
entries: The grandchild retainer is inspired by the {@subclass Wicked Witch|Sorcerer|PHB|Ar8|Wicked Witch sorcerous origin}.

entries.name: Folklorist
